page.title: 12Local History
page.content: Before 1935, there were not many dwellings in the area, apart from large houses,cottages for estate and farm workers.There were a few timber-framed chalet bungalows, often built by their owners on huge plots of land.Living was primitive, as there were no roads, drains,lighting or water,although wells were easily sunk in the clay. Residential development really dates from 1927,when a builder called Christmas bought land cheaply, and put up many small two-bedroomed bungalows in Bricket Wood.He provided his own water-supply and sewerage system.In the same village,in 1955-6,Blackboy Wood Estate was built by Handley Page Aircraft Co.Ltd (established at nearby Colney Street).After that,as communications with London and other towns was excellent, the area developed rapidly.
